title: A life enhancing tool in the palm of your hand.
text: "ChatGPT has been a game-changer for me! The app's intuitive interface and ChatGPT's ability to provide insightful and quick responses have made my user experience exceptional. Whether I need information, assistance, or just a friendly chat, ChatGPT delivers. It's like having a knowledgeable companion in my pocket. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a reliable and intelligent conversational experience!"

title: Fantastic app!
text:
I love the haptic feedback when the model is "typing," nice touch! 
Would love to hear a sound when a generation is complete though. 
Additionally, given that it uses Whisper and Whisper is amazing, could we see hands-free access sometime soon? Would love to be able to open the app, hit the dictation button and talk to Chatgpt while on the go. Bing Chat lets you do this (kind of) but the speach recognition they use is awful!

title: UI ergonomics and accessibility
text:
In the iOS app front-end and the web UI, the chatbot prints its responses slowly gradually, letter by letter. Each new line vertically shifts the whole prompt, and my eyes have trouble tracking the words I am trying to read. It would be a much nicer experience to see the entire response printed immediately and wholesale. Similar UI modifications could help users with accessibility needs.

The underlying LLM changes the world, as we all know. I am taking that for granted in this review.

title: A little more brain power that isn‚Äôt always right.
text:
The ideas ChatGPT comes up with are good. However I‚Äôd like to see a knowledge update. The last update was a year ago and with knowledge growing exponentially its knowledge base is falling behind.
It‚Äôs hugely superior to a search engine. Search engines are manipulated to keep putting the same info on top and it‚Äôs hard to find the real information I‚Äôm looking for.

title: The future is here.
text: Consistently great, constant updates to make the app better. Voice to text is amazingly useful (meeting recaps, brain dumps, ideas, etc.). I am thrilled to see where OpenAI takes things over the next 10 years. It‚Äôs already nothing short of astonishing. So I‚Äôm not sure what word could possibly describe what this technology will be like in ten years time‚Ä¶ To a better future!

title: ChatGPT review
text:

title: Great app
text:
OpenAI's ChatGPT app impresses with its advanced AI and user-friendly updates, making features like image generation and web browsing a breeze. However, server reliability issues and some questionable updates, such as limiting image generation and modifications, can be frustrating. Despite these challenges, the app's innovative AI capabilities and overall functionality justify the $20 plus subscription, making it a valuable tool in the digital space.

This review was written with chatGPT 4

title: enjoying ai
text: i‚Äôve had this app for a while now and I come back every so often to chat and see how it‚Äôs changed. The most recent changes have been phenomenal. I‚Äôve been chatting more as a result. AI‚Äôs responses are significantly better, more thought out, and relevant. i asked a hypothetical question on walrus evolution and got such a fantastic answer, I‚Äôve been up for an hour now asking about evolution. Thanks guys ü•∞

title: Far easier than website
text: The app version of ChatGPT is far quicker to get to than the website, and it works just as well. Being able to open this at any time and begin talking to GPT within 5 seconds is great. My only complaint is that the history regarding previous conversations isn‚Äôt as straightforward, and I wish there was a way to manually save conversations.

title: Incomplete AI
text: For a Chat AI it is limited in the ways of thinking and tends to repeat itself. I find this annoying and also useless as in conversations it will be discriminatory towards certain ways of thinking due to policy and social standards. This limiting it‚Äôs own form of chatting and understanding, although it‚Äôs cool in some areas but it‚Äôs ignorant in social justice and acceptance as well as understandings of science. There can be far better chat AIs that aren‚Äôt discriminatory towards those it doesn‚Äôt understand, such as the derogatory term of ‚Äúcisgenders‚Äù instead of straight male or females and the rights in which they have. Instead it tends to favor those of transgenders even if it‚Äôs harmful to a normal men and women.

title: Fantastic app with some improvements needed
text:
This is such a great app to have on your phone! However, it is lacking a few things right now. OpenAI, here are three ways I‚Äôd love to see the app improved, please:
1. Widgets for the Lock Screen and Home Screen (including one that automatically begins recording a voice prompt on press)
2. Support for Siri Shortcuts
3. Image-creation ability in app
4. Ability to see text as it‚Äôs dictated

title: bug
text: The device is iPad mini6. No matter how you click the voice dialogue button, it doesn't respond, and when you submit text, you have to enter two carriage returns and click a few more times to submit. Other software doesn't have this problem, and there is no problem with my tablet. I hope we can find out the problem.

title: It‚Äôs not bad.
text:
I like the app; I feel it's very knowledgeable. 
I use it to help me with my grammatical errors and when I need to quickly find information. 
I love writing poetry, and I wanted to see if it's good at that, but unfortunately, it's not. 
The way it writes lacks emotion, and it consistently uses the same words in every poem. Words like 'tapestry,' 'threads,' 'canvas,' and 'twilight' appear in every poem, even if you ask it not to use them. 
I dislike that it censors itself and gives you a lecture if you write something that it or the programmers feel is 'inappropriate,' I guess. Additionally, if you inquire about song lyrics, it claims it can't help due to copyright issues. However, for other information or checking writing for grammatical errors, it's perfect.

(I did use it to check my punctuation and correct any grammatical errors in this review üëçüèª)

title: The Real deal
text:

The IOS version work great on my iPhone 14 Pro Max. You can also chat with GPT at your desktop!

title: Restricts free speech
text: This application can come in very handy when one is trying to enhance writing, however, let there be no doubt it‚Äôs overly sensitive and considers many things ‚Äúoffensive‚Äù. title: Deletion does not work
text: The app has a minimalistic design with only a few features, which is something I appreciate. However, one of these features, the deletion option, does not function properly. Upon turning off "Chat History and Training," selecting the option to delete a conversation by clicking on the three dots and pressing "Delete" fails to perform the task. Instead, users are required to go through the process of accessing "Settings," navigating to "Data Controls," and ultimately choosing "Clear chat history" to fully delete a conversation.

title: My phone heats up like crazy when using this app
text:
Not sure why but my phone heats up like crazy when using this app. I‚Äôll have to try turning the haptics off and seeing if that helps. That doesn‚Äôt happen when using the website so I think I‚Äôll mostly stick to using the website. 

I also think the app could use some better UI. It‚Äôs a bit too sparse and minimalistic. There should be more visible UI elements where you can see how to navigate the app including chat history, starting a new chat etc.

title: No plug ins or internet search available with plus
